author: Reuters Editorial
title: New York home healthcare provider reaches $6.4 million settlement
text:
A New York home healthcare provider and its president have agreed to pay $6.4 million to resolve claims that they falsely billed Medicaid for services they did not actually provide patients.
The settlement with Home Family Care Inc and Alexander Kiselev, the companyâ€™s co-owner and president, was announced on Wednesday by U.S. Attorney Richard Donoghue in Brooklyn. A former HFC vice president, Michael Gurevich, entered into a separate settlement resolving the same allegations.
To read the full story on WestlawNext Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2npqQ75
